Article Title: Nvidia praises Chinese AI startup DeepSeek, calls it “an excellent AI advancement”
Article Text:
Image credit: Reuters



What is DeepSeek

DeepSeek hit by cyber attack

Nvidia has emphasized that Chinese AI firm DeepSeek’s progress underscores the value of its chips in the Chinese market, adding that future demand for its hardware will likely grow to support DeepSeek’s expanding services. The chip maker released a statement on Monday, January 27 following a sharp 17% drop driven by investor concerns that DeepSeek had matched competitors like OpenAI while using significantly fewer Nvidia chips than US-based firms."DeepSeek is an excellent AI advancement and a perfect example of Test Time Scaling. DeepSeek’s work illustrates how new models can be created using that technique, leveraging widely-available models and compute that is fully export control compliant," Nvidia said in its statement.“Inference requires significant numbers of NVIDIA GPUs and high-performance networking. We now have three scaling laws: pre-training and post-training, which continue, and new test-time scaling,” said Nvidia.DeepSeek is a large language model developed by Hangzhou-based startup DeepSeek. The AI model features a hybrid architecture combining reinforcement learning with chain-of-thought reasoning for advanced performance. The model comes in two versions: DeepSeek-R1 and DeepSeek-R1-Zero. The latter offers unsupervised fine-tuning, enabling even more refined reasoning abilities.Nvidia is currently selling a chip called the H20 that is designed to meet the most recent export control regulations. DeepSeek’s research indicates it utilized around 2,000 of Nvidia’s H800 chips, specifically designed to comply with US export controls introduced in 2022. Experts previously told Reuters that these regulations, aimed at hindering China’s AI progress, would likely have minimal impact.Meanwhile, the Chinese AI startup was forced to restrict new user sign-ups to those with mainland China telephone numbers. Reason: The company is citing "large-scale malicious attacks" on its systems. “Currently, only registration with a mainland China mobile phone number is supported,” the company posted on its status page. DeepSeek did not specify whether the signup curbs are temporary or how long they will last.
Article Summary: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek saw a 17% drop in its share price on Monday, January 27. Nvidia said the firm's progress underscores the value of its chips in the Chinese market. The chip maker added that future demand for its hardware will likely grow to support Deep Seek's expanding services.

Article Title: ‘The big Chinese worry’ troubling Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg and his leadership
Article Text: Meta ’s leadership is growing increasingly concerned about DeepSeek , a Chinese artificial intelligence company whose latest model has outperformed established players at a fraction of the cost. Not just that, but the Chinese AI app has also grown in popularity, so much so, it overthrew ChatGPT as the most downloaded app in the iOS App Store, in the US.The company's infrastructure leaders worry that Meta's upcoming Llama AI model might not match DeepSeek's capabilities, potentially undermining its massive AI investments .According to The Information, Meta's AI infrastructure director Mathew Oldham and other executives have expressed apprehension in internal discussions about DeepSeek's rapid advancement. "It's not that China's AI is surpassing the US, but rather that open source models are surpassing proprietary ones," LeCun stated on Threads.LeCun emphasized that DeepSeek's achievements stem from its ability to build upon existing open research, highlighting the collaborative nature of AI development . "They came up with new ideas and built them on top of other people's work. Because their work is published and open source, everyone can profit from it," he explained.The development comes as Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg continues to champion open-source AI development, having previously stated his goal of making open platforms dominant in the tech industry over the next decade.Meta has committed over $60 billion in AI spending for 2025, while DeepSeek's ability to achieve comparable or superior results with lower infrastructure costs raises questions about the sustainability of such massive investments by US tech giants.

Article Text: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff predicting a dramatic shift in their artificial intelligence partnership. This personal friction coincides with Microsoft's strategic moves, including hiring Suleyman to lead its AI efforts.The partnership's foundation has gradually eroded since Microsoft's initial $1 billion investment in 2019. OpenAI's need for expanded computational resources and Microsoft's own AI ambitions have created increasing distance between the two organizations.Recent Microsoft AI announcements notably omit any mention of OpenAI, suggesting a potential strategic divergence. The tech giant is reportedly developing its own large language model, MAI-1, further indicating potential independence from the OpenAI partnership.Benioff, whose Salesforce uses OpenAI's enterprise models and has invested in competitor Anthropic, seems to relish the developing situation.
Article Summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff predicts a dramatic shift in their artificial intelligence partnership. The partnership's foundation has gradually eroded since Microsoft's initial $1 billion investment in 2019. Article Text:
Design

Samsung launched its most expensive Galaxy S-series smartphone – Galaxy S25 Ultra at its first Galaxy Unpacked event of 2025 in San Jose, US. With its sleek design, powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, and top-tier camera capabilities, the S25 Ultra is designed to impress the consumers. The smartphone comes with a starting price tag of Rs 1,29,999 and it packs in a lot of features and looks like a compelling buy.We got the chance to spend some time with the new Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra and here’s our first impressions of the new Samsung smartphone.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra has borrowed its design aesthetics from its predecessor. The most expensive S series smartphone from Samsung continues the trend of refined aesthetics with a squared-off titanium frame and Gorilla Glass Armor 2. The Gorilla Glass Armor 2 on the Galaxy S25 Ultra is scratch resistant and it also provides anti-reflective glass ceramic cover the the smartphone. The design is both durable and elegant, with a slimmer and lighter build compared to its predecessors. The phone now features smoother, rounded corners, making it more comfortable to hold. The ride side of the smartphone houses the volume rockers and the power button. Apart from waking up the smartphone, the users can also use the power button to activate Google Gemini. The bottom part of the smartphone houses the USB Type C charging case, the slot for S Pen and the SIM card tray. The front is dominated by a 6.9-inch AMOLED display and the rear of the smartphone houses the quad-camera setup placed neatly in the top right corner. The smartphone also comes with IP68 rating which makes it resistant to dust and water. The overall build of Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra exudes sophistication, maintaining its status as a flagship device.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra sports a 6.9-inch Quad HD+ Infinity-O-Edge AMOLED display. The display on the smartphone offers a variable refresh rate of up to 120Hz. The screen is protected with a coating of Corning Gorilla Armor 2 glass which makes it resistant to scratches. We really liked the display on the flagship Samsung smartphone. It offers a crisp resolution, smooth 120Hz adaptive refresh rate, and enhanced Vision Booster for vivid outdoor viewing. Samsung has further enhanced brightness levels, making it easy to view even under harsh sunlight. The colour accuracy and HDR performance ensure vibrant visuals, whether you're gaming or streaming videos.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is powered by Android’s most powerful and advanced chipset – Snapdragon 8 Elite. The smartphone comes in three variants – 12GB+256GB, 12GB+512GB and 12GB + 1TB. The smartphone performed well during our initial testing and we didn’t face any lag. We had a smooth experience during multitasking and gaming. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is backed by a 5,000 mAh battery which comes with 45W fast charging support. The smartphone also supports Qi wireless charging. Samsung claims that the smartphone can charge from 0to 65% in just 30 minutes. However, we are yet to test this functionality and the battery backup of the smartphone. The dual SIM smartphone comes equipped with an in- display fingerprint sensor and sports a quad rear camera setup.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra runs Android 15 operating system topped with the company's own layer of One UI 7. Samsung has also confirmed that the Galaxy S25 Ultra will get seven years of OS and security updates. Coming to One UI 7, the AI integration in One UI 7 feels more intuitive, with features like natural language search and context-aware multitasking. The AI features of the OS come with a significant new look, based on a new notification system that streamlines communication with easy access from the device's lock screen. It includes Now Bar, which highlights relevant activities across various features like Interpreter, Music, Recording, Stopwatch and more. One UI 7 also reduces visual clutter and offers a simplified homescreen, redesigned One UI widgets, and lock screen which enhances the user experience. We will talk more about the software in our detailed review of the smartphone.Same as its predecessor, the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra also sports a quad rear camera setup. The rear camera consists of 200MP main camera with f/1.7 aperture, 50MP ultra wide sensor with f/1.9 aperture, 10MP telephoto lens with 3x optical zoom and f/2.4 aperture and 50MP periscope telephoto lens for 5x optical zoom and f/3.4 aperture. Front houses a 12MP selfie camera with f/2.2 aperture. The camera delivered some really impressive results during our initial testing. The primary sensor on the Galaxy S25 Ultra manages to capture incredible detail and dynamic range. The AI enhancements bring sharper portraits and more accurate colour reproduction. Features like depth-of-field control and Galaxy Log enhance creative possibilities and help users do much more with the camera. Also, the redesigned camera UX allows more intuitive control over advanced settings. Camera buttons, controls, and modes have been reorganised to make it easier to find the features you need and to give you a clearer preview of the picture you’re taking or the video you're recording. For the detailed camera analysis, you will have to wait for our detailed review.Overall, the Galaxy S25 Ultra feels like a refined iteration of an already impressive formula. Its snappier UI, AI enhancements, and polished design make it a top contender in the flagship smartphone segment. The smartphone offers a sleek design and all the high-end and powerful specifications. But will that be enough? Wait for our detailed review to find out more.

Article Title: How China's Deepseek sent shockwaves in American stock market, wiping out billions from market cap of tech superstar
Article Text:
Billions of dollars erased

Time for reversal for AI stocks

The emergence of a Chinese competitor in the artificial intelligence (AI) space sparked a sharp sell-off in Wall Street's tech sector on Monday, casting doubt on the AI-driven spending boom. Big Tech stocks faced significant losses, with Nvidia plunging 14.4%, pulling the Nasdaq Composite down by 2.8%. Bloomberg reported that the Nasdaq 100 index dropped over 3%, with Nvidia on track to record the largest single-stock market cap loss in history.The S&P 500 fell 1.7% by midday, on track for its worst day in over a month.Big Tech stocks led the decline, with Nvidia plummeting 14.4%, pulling the Nasdaq composite down 2.8%. In contrast, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, less reliant on tech, experienced a modest 0.1% dip (54 points).The market shock stemmed from DeepSeek, a Chinese company claiming to have developed a cost-effective large language model competitive with U.S. counterparts. DeepSeek's app quickly topped Apple 's App Store charts, a notable achievement given U.S. restrictions on Chinese access to advanced AI chips.Despite the market reaction, skepticism remains about DeepSeek's long-term impact on the AI supply chain, from chip manufacturing to data center infrastructure. Wedbush Securities analyst Dan Ives highlighted concerns about DeepSeek's ability to circumvent chip restrictions, given the information's source.Nevertheless, DeepSeek's announcement reverberated through global markets. Dutch chip supplier ASML dropped 6.6%, and Japan's Softbank Group Corp. fell 8.3%, partially reversing gains from a recent AI infrastructure investment announcement. In the U.S., Constellation Energy, linked to powering Microsoft's data centers, plummeted 19%.The flight to safety pushed investors towards bonds, lowering the 10-year Treasury yield to 4.54% from 4.62%.This marks a stark reversal for AI-related stocks, which had surged in recent years. Nvidia, for instance, had seen its stock price multiply in less than two years. Other Big Tech companies, including Meta Platforms, had also benefited from the AI hype, with Meta recently announcing significant data center investments.The dominance of a few tech giants, dubbed the "Magnificent Seven" (Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla), has created "concentration risk," as these companies accounted for over half of the S&P 500's return last year. This concentration amplifies the impact of disruptions like DeepSeek's emergence.However, some analysts caution against overreacting. Annex Wealth Management's Brian Jacobsen suggested that the news from China might be overstated or present new investment opportunities.Further market volatility is possible, with Apple, Meta, Microsoft, and Tesla scheduled to release earnings this week. Strong earnings are crucial, especially given recent increases in Treasury yields, which typically pressure stock prices.
Article Summary: Big Tech stocks led the decline, with Nvidia plummeting 14.4%, pulling the Nasdaq composite down 2.8%. The flight to safety pushed investors towards bonds, lowering the 10-year Treasury yield to 4.54% from 4.62%. This marks a stark reversal for AI-related stocks, which had surged in recent years.

Article Title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu is stepping down as CEO, takes this new role
Article Text:
Sridhar Vembu, CEO, Zoho

Zoho Corporation 's CEO and co-founder, Sridhar Vembu , has announced his decision to step down from his position as CEO. Vembu will transition to the role of chief scientist at the company, where he plans to focus on deep research and development (R&D) initiatives, especially in the rapidly advancing fields of artificial intelligence (AI) and technology.In a statement on social media platform X, Vembu explained his decision, citing the various challenges and opportunities the company faces. "In view of the various challenges and opportunities facing us, including recent major developments in AI, it has been decided that it is best for me to focus full-time on R&D initiatives, along with pursuing my personal rural development mission," Vembu said.As part of the leadership transition, co-founder Shailesh Kumar Davey will take over as the new Group CEO of Zoho Corporation. Another co-founder, Tony Thomas, will lead Zoho's US operations, while Rajesh Ganesan will head ManageEngine, and Mani Vembu will oversee the Zoho.com division.Vembu's new role will enable him to dive back into hands-on technical work, a move he expressed excitement about. "I am happy to return to hands-on technical work and focus on deep R&D efforts," he added. Vembu's dedication to innovation and his personal mission for rural development have been pivotal in shaping Zoho's growth and success.“The future of our company entirely depends on how well we navigate the R&D challenge and I am looking forward to my new assignment with energy and vigor. I am also very happy to get back to hands on technical work,” concluded Vembu in his post.

Article Title: Apple in talks with Bharat Forge to boost local manufacturing in India: Report
Article Text: iPhone-maker Apple is reportedly in talks with Bharat Forge, a Kalyani Group company, to join its growing network of Indian suppliers. Citing unnamed sources, an Economic Times report said that if finalized, Bharat Forge would manufacture components, including mechanical parts, for the tech giant. “Apple is looking to work with some of the biggest Indian companies and talks have commenced with Bharat Forge, located in Pune, Maharashtra,” a source told the publication.For those unaware, Bharat Forge is a prominent Indian manufacturing company led by 76-year-old Baba Kalyani.Employing nearly 5,000 people, the company operates across diverse sectors, including forging, automotive, energy, construction, mining, railways, marine, aerospace, and defense, with multiple subsidiaries supporting its operations. Headquartered in Pune, its potential collaboration with Apple aligns with the company's push for increased local production.Apple already has similar partnerships with Tata Group , Motherson Group, and Aequs. Over the past two years, Apple has been expanding its Indian supplier ecosystem to boost local value addition and reduce dependence on China. Current suppliers include iPhone assembly plants operated by Foxconn and Tata Group, as well as component makers like Sunwoda, Foxlink, and Aequs. Battery supplier Amperex Technology Ltd (ATL) is also setting up a facility in Haryana.In 2024, Apple produced iPhones worth $17.5 billion in India, achieving $12.8 billion in exports and increasing local value addition from 5-8% in 2020 to nearly 20%. The company is expected to onboard more local suppliers in the coming year.Annual iPhone production at Tata Electronics soared to over Rs 40,000 crore in 2024, reporting a 180% year-on-year increase.
Article Summary: Apple is reportedly in talks with Bharat Forge, a Kalyani Group company, to join its growing network of Indian suppliers. Apple has been expanding its Indian supplier ecosystem to boost local value addition and reduce dependence on China. Current suppliers include iPhone assembly plants operated by Foxconn and Tata Group, as well as component makers.

Article Title: WhatsApp testing multi-account support for iOS users: Here’s what it means for users
Article Text: WhatsApp is testing a highly anticipated multi-account support feature for iOS. This new functionality, available in the latest beta version 25.2.10.70 through TestFlight, allows iPhone users to manage multiple WhatsApp accounts within a single app.As reported by WABetaInfo, WhatsApp is developing a feature that enables users to log into multiple accounts within a single app, catering to those who manage different phone numbers for personal, professional, or other purposes.This update will simplify account management by allowing users to add accounts through app settings and choose between starting fresh or linking an existing account via QR code.Previously limited to Android users, this feature is designed to simplify account management, eliminating the need for multiple devices or separate WhatsApp versions. By offering the ability to log into and switch between accounts using a streamlined user interface, WhatsApp aims to enhance user experience.The multi-account feature provides two options for adding new accounts: setting up a primary account from scratch or linking an additional account via QR code. Each account operates independently, with separate chats, notifications, backups, and settings. This feature is particularly beneficial for dual SIM users who can now manage both numbers within the primary app.This feature is currently under development and is anticipated to be part of a future WhatsApp update .
Article Summary: WhatsApp is testing a new multi-account support feature for iOS. This new functionality allows iPhone users to manage multiple WhatsApp accounts within a single app. This update will simplify account management by allowing users to add accounts through app settings and choose between starting fresh or linking an existing account via QR code.

Article Title: The Chinese AI app that has done what Google Gemini 'could not' in the US
Article Text:
What is DeepSeek

DeepSeek , the latest entrant in the artificial intelligence (AI) space, has become the most downloaded app on Apple's App Store in the US, sparking anxiety across Silicon Valley with its meteoric rise. The app is already being compared to those of industry giants like OpenAI , Google and Microsoft . Hours after the app topped the App Store listing, beating OpenAI’s ChatGPT Perplexity AI CEO Aravind Srinivas congratulated.In a post on microblogging platform X (formerly Twitter), Srinivas wrote “Congrats to @deepseek_ai for getting to #1 on the App Store. For a while, it wasn't clear who would beat ChatGPT for the first time. The best we could manage was #8, a year ago. Look forward to using all their models for search, assistant, and agents this year.”In the post, he also shared screenshots of the App Store listing, showing DeepSeek - AI Assistant as #1 app.DeepSeek R1 is a cutting-edge large language model designed to elevate reasoning and analytical capabilities. It has been developed by Hangzhou-based startup DeepSeek and features a hybrid architecture combining reinforcement learning with chain-of-thought reasoning for advanced performance. The model comes in two versions: DeepSeek-R1 and DeepSeek-R1-Zero. The latter offers unsupervised fine-tuning, enabling even more refined reasoning abilities.According to a report in NewYork Times, DeepSeek's engineers reported using significantly fewer specialized computer chips, crucial components in AI training, than their American counterparts. These chips are central to the technological competition between the U.S. and China, with the U.S. imposing export restrictions to maintain its AI leadership. However, DeepSeek's success highlights potential unintended consequences of these restrictions, as Chinese researchers have been driven to innovate with readily available resources.
Article Summary: DeepSeek has become the most downloaded app on Apple's App Store in the US. The app is already being compared to those of industry giants like OpenAI, Google and Microsoft. Hours after the app topped the App Store listing, DeepSeek CEO Aravind Srinivas congratulated.

Article Title: Apple Watch: Apple watch’s SOS feature saves skier’s life after 1,000-foot fall in freezing conditions
Article Text:
How an Apple watch saved a skier from freezing after a terrifying fall

How fall detection and SOS make Apple watch a must have for safety

Fall Detection: Fall Detection uses the accelerometer and gyroscope in the watch to detect major falls. In case of a fall, the watch taps the user on the wrist and asks if he is fine. If the user does not respond within a minute, the watch will automatically call emergency services and share the user's location with them. This feature is very helpful for the elderly or for people who have medical conditions that raise the risk of falling.

SOS: Users can quickly access the emergency service with the press and hold feature using the side button of their Apple Watch. This will alert their emergency contact and share their location. SOS works on any type of Apple Watch model.

Also Read:

Imagine being 1,000 feet down a snowy mountainside, injured, freezing, and alone. For most, that is all but a nightmare with little hope for survival. In this incredible story, however, the hero was not a man nor was it a rescue dog but rather an Apple Watch . Being equipped with its SOS feature, the watch actually sensed the fall and sent an emergency alert that rescued the skier just in the nick of time.What might have been a calamity of an apocalyptic end turned into the most unbelievable story of survival just because of a tiny gadget that was strapped onto their wrist. Curious of how it went? Here is the full storyWhen a skier fell 1,000 feet down a snowy slope, his Apple Watch came into play. When it sensed the hard fall, the Watch's Emergency SOS feature automatically alerted rescuers and sent them the skier's exact GPS location—all without him lifting a finger.Precise coordinates helped rescue him in time before the freezing conditions could mark him as another victim. He has been well treated for his injuries, thanks to the advanced technology of the Watch.For example, with features like Fall Detection and Emergency SOS, Apple Watch can dial for help when it detects an abrupt fall or crash, even if the wearer can't make that call. The feature also lets emergency contacts know so that proper assistance is rendered in time. In this particular case, life-saving tech works perfectly, as sometimes, just a little gadget can make all the difference.Apple Watch comes with two major safety features: Fall Detection and SOS. These functions aim to help the user in case of an emergency by quickly allowing others to know or alerting emergency services if necessary.
Article Summary: Apple Watch comes with two major safety features: Fall Detection and SOS. Fall Detection uses the accelerometer and gyroscope in the watch to detect major falls. Emergency SOS lets users dial for help when it detects an abrupt fall or crash, even if the wearer can't make that call.

Article Title: Perplexity AI proposes $300 billion TikTok plan; suggests this new ownership structure
Article Text:
File photo

What the revised proposal says

Donald Trump’s support to Elon Musk to buy TikTok

Perplexity AI has submitted a revised proposal to TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, suggesting the creation of a new entity that merges Perplexity with TikTok's US operations. According to an AP report, this new structure would allow the US government to own up to 50% of the entity. The report states that the updated proposal was submitted last week and builds on an earlier plan presented to ByteDance on January 18—just one day before the US law banning TikTok took effect.The original proposal outlined a framework for merging San Francisco-based Perplexity with TikTok's US business and funding from additional investors.The proposal offers a middle ground for ByteDance, allowing it to maintain some connection to TikTok without fully severing ties. However, it would require ByteDance to relinquish control to a fully US-based board.Under the revised plan, the US government could acquire up to half of the new company's shares after an initial public offering (IPO) valued at a minimum of $300 billion. However, these government-held shares would not carry voting rights, nor would the US government gain a seat on the company's board, the report said.Importantly, the plan stipulates that TikTok's proprietary algorithm—the core of the app's content recommendation engine—would not be included in the US business contributed by ByteDance.US President Donald Trump has previously expressed support for Tesla CEO Elon Musk potentially acquiring TikTok, suggesting a novel arrangement in which the US government would hold a 50% ownership stake in exchange for granting operating permits."I would be, if he wanted to buy it, yes," Trump stated during a press briefing on Tuesday, January 21, when asked about Musk's possible interest in the platform. He also mentioned Oracle Chairman Larry Ellison, saying, "I'd like Larry to buy it, too."
Article Summary: Perplexity AI has submitted a revised proposal to TikTok's parent company, ByteDance. The new structure would allow the US government to own up to 50% of the entity. US President Donald Trump has previously expressed support for Tesla CEO Elon Musk potentially acquiring TikTok.

Article Title: How DeepSeek, the Chinese competitor to American AI companies OpenAI, Google and Microsoft, solves one of the biggest 'China problem'
Article Text:
Representative image

The Chinese startup DeepSeek has unveiled a new AI system, DeepSeek-V3, demonstrating capabilities comparable to leading chatbots from OpenAI and Google. This achievement is significant in itself, but even more notable is DeepSeek's efficient use of computing resources. According to a report in NewYork Times, DeepSeek's engineers reported using significantly fewer specialized computer chips, crucial components in AI training, than their American counterparts.These chips are central to the technological competition between the U.S. and China, with the U.S. imposing export restrictions to maintain its AI leadership. However, DeepSeek's success highlights potential unintended consequences of these restrictions, as Chinese researchers have been driven to innovate with readily available resources.DeepSeek-V3 reportedly performed on par with existing market offerings in benchmark tests assessing question answering, logic problem-solving, and code generation. Remarkably, DeepSeek achieved this with approximately $6 million in computing power, a fraction of the estimated $60 million spent by Meta on its latest AI technology. This lower cost of entry broadens the field of potential AI developers, as noted by investor Chris V. Nicholson, who pointed out the significant difference between having $6 million versus $100 million or $1 billion available.While leading AI companies often utilize supercomputers with 16,000 or more chips, DeepSeek reportedly used only around 2,000 Nvidia chips. This efficient use of resources was attributed to optimized training methods necessitated by chip constraints in China.Despite U.S. efforts to restrict China's access to advanced chips, including recent regulations aimed at preventing acquisition through third countries, DeepSeek is said to leverage existing resources. The company, backed by quantitative trading firm High Flyer, had previously acquired Nvidia chips and attracted talent with competitive salaries and research opportunities. They even hire individuals without computer science backgrounds to enhance the AI's understanding of diverse subjects like poetry and performance on challenging exams.While U.S. companies continue to innovate, with OpenAI's new "reasoning" system being a prime example, DeepSeek's rapid progress, including its own impressive reasoning model, demonstrates its competitiveness, as per the report.A key aspect of this evolving landscape is open-source software. DeepSeek has open-sourced its latest AI system, sharing the code with others. This fosters global collaboration, as noted by Yineng Zhang, a software engineer at Baseten. This open-source approach gained momentum in 2023 with Meta's release of LLama. DeepSeek's contribution demonstrates that smaller players can also contribute significantly to the open-source AI ecosystem.
Article Summary: DeepSeek-V3 reportedly performed on par with existing market offerings in benchmark tests assessing question answering, logic problem-solving, and code generation. Remarkably, DeepSeek achieved this with approximately $6 million in computing power, a fraction of the estimated $60 million spent by Meta.

Article Title: OpenAI faces new copyright case in India over use of books without permission
Article Text:
What the lawsuit says

ANI accuses OpenAI of illegally using its content

Sam Altman-led OpenAI is facing a new copyright lawsuit in India. According to a Reuters report, Indian book publishers and their international counterparts in New Delhi have filed a lawsuit aimed at halting the ChatGPT chatbot’s access to proprietary content. The lawsuit was filed by Federation of Indian Publishers on behalf of the federation's members, including prominent publishers such as Bloomsbury, Penguin Random House, Cambridge University Press, and Pan Macmillan, as well as Indian publishers like Rupa Publications and S.Chand and Co.The case, initially listed before a registrar in New Delhi, will be heard by a judge on January 28.In the lawsuit, the Federation of Indian Publishers argues that OpenAI's services in India should be governed by Indian laws. The federation’s December filing claims OpenAI used its members’ literary works without permission to train ChatGPT, with evidence from publishers. They warn that AI-generated book summaries and extracts, often from unlicensed online copies, threaten their sales.Penguin Random House announced a global initiative in November to include a copyright disclaimer in its books, stating no part may be used to train AI.The report quotes Pranav Gupta, the federation's general secretary who said "Our ask from the court is that they should stop (OpenAI from) accessing our copyright content.” “In case they don't want to do licensing with us, they should delete datasets used in AI training and explain how we will be compensated. This impacts creativity,” he added.OpenAI is already facing a lawsuit in India. ANI (Asian News International), a prominent news agency alleges that the tech company used its content without permission to train its AI chatbot, ChatGPT. ANI claims that OpenAI not only utilised its copyrighted material without a lawful licence but also accused the company of attributing fabricated news stories to the agency.Globally, the ChatGPT-maker is facing a list of legal challenges from various global news organisations and copyright holders, including The New York Times and The Chicago Tribune, who have similarly accused OpenAI of using their work without authorization.
Article Summary: Indian book publishers and their international counterparts in New Delhi have filed a lawsuit aimed at halting the ChatGPT chatbot’s access to proprietary content. The lawsuit was filed by Federation of Indian Publishers on behalf of the federation's members, including prominent publishers such as Bloomsbury, Penguin Random House, Cambridge University Press, and Pan Macmillan. The case will be heard by a judge on January 28.

Article Title: Google revamps mobile search URLs for a sleeker appearance
Article Text: Google has announced a major update to its mobile search results, aimed at simplifying the appearance of URLs for a more user-friendly experience. This redesign focuses on presenting a cleaner and more streamlined look, enhancing readability and usability on mobile devices.Like all organising efforts, this one came with its challenges. “Rethinking the visual design for something like Search is really complex,” Aileen says.“That’s especially true given how much Google Search has evolved. We’re not just organising the web’s information, but all the world’s information,” Aileen says. “We started with organising web pages, but now there’s so much diversity in the types of content and information we have to help make sense of.”Previously, Google's mobile search results often displayed long, complex URLs that could be challenging to parse quickly. This change involves removing the breadcrumb element from mobile search results, which frequently got cut off on smaller screens. Instead, Google will now show only the most critical parts of the URL, such as the domain name and a simplified path.Google explained that this update is designed to make it easier for users to understand where a link will take them without unnecessary clutter. The company emphasised that this change will apply to all languages and regions where Google Search is available on mobile. Meanwhile, the breadcrumb element will still be present on desktop search results.“We hope this change makes it easier for people to find what they're looking for when they're searching on mobile,” a Google representative mentioned in a blog post. The cleaner format aims to offer a more intuitive and user-friendly browsing experience , especially on smaller screens.
Article Summary: Google has announced a major update to its mobile search results, aimed at simplifying the appearance of URLs for a more user-friendly experience. This redesign focuses on presenting a cleaner and more streamlined look, enhancing readability and usability on mobile devices. Google will now show only the most critical parts of the URL, such as the domain name.

Article Title: Kumbh Mela: 93-year-old record that Steve Jobs wife Laurene Powell's international flight at Prayagraj airport broke
Article Text:
Poll Should Kumbh Mela Be Open to Global Participation? No, It Should Be Exclusive to Devotees Yes, It Promotes Cultural Understanding

How is Laurene Powell’s flight from Prayagraj significant

Poll What Do You Think of Laurene Powell Jobs Breaking the 93-Year-Old Record at Kumbh Mela? A Significant Moment for Prayagraj's Modernization A Historic Milestone for Indian Aviation

‘Steve Jobs wish’ behind wife Laurene attending Kumbh Mela

Steve Jobs' final gift: Hindu Guru's book

Autobiography of a Yogi

Laurene Powell Jobs , the wife of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs , recently attended the Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj, one of the world's largest spiritual gatherings. Although health concerns kept her from taking the holy dip in the Ganga on the event's opening day, her visit drew significant attention. Laurene later made headlines by becoming part of a historic moment following her spiritual journey at the Kumbh.A Bhutan Airways aircraft recently landed at Prayagraj airport , carrying American billionaire Laurene Powell Jobs.After attending the Maha Kumbh Mela, she returned to Bhutan on the same plane. This marked Prayagraj's first international flight in 93 years, a historic milestone for the airport.In 1911, Henri Piquet initiated domestic commercial aviation in India, flying mail from Allahabad (now Prayagraj) to Naini. By 1931, the Allahabad aerodrome was established, becoming one of India’s first international airports, with flights to London until 1932.In a letter dated February 2 3, 1974 and addressed to his childhood friend Tim Brown, Jobs expressed his desire to attend the Kumbh Mela, a grand Hindu pilgrimage and festival celebrated by millions. He wrote, "I wish to go to India for the Kumbh Mela, which starts in April. I will be leaving sometime in March, not really certain yet." The letter, closing with "Shanti, Steve Jobs," provides a touching testament to his deep connection with Hindu philosophy and spirituality. It also includes a poignant note about Jobs having "cried many times," offering a rare glimpse into his emotional depth.The letter was recently auctioned for $500,321.50 (roughly Rs 4.32 crore).Steve Jobs' spiritual journey bought him to India when at Neem Karoli Ashram in Uttarakhand. While the saint has passed away years before his arrival, the teachings deeply influenced Jobs.The Book --written by Hindu guru Paramahansa Yogananda had a profound significance for Steve Jobs. As noted in Walter Isaacson’s biography, Jobs first read the book as a teenager, revisited it during his trip to India, and continued reading it annually. Such was the impact that his final gift to his friends was a copy of the book.
Article Summary: Laurene Powell Jobs recently attended the Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj, India. The event is one of the world's largest spiritual gatherings. Laurene later made headlines by becoming part of a historic moment following her spiritual journey. A Bhutan Airways aircraft recently landed at Prayagraj airport carrying American billionaire Laureneowell Jobs. This marked Prayragraj's first international flight in 93 years, a historic milestone.

Article Title: Meta’s $65 billion ‘AI answer’ to OpenAI, Oracle and other companies’ Stargate project
Article Text: Meta Platforms , the parent company of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp, plans to spend up to $65 billion in 2025 to dramatically expand its artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure, CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced.The substantial capital expenditure represents a significant increase from the company's $38-40 billion spending in 2024. Zuckerberg aims to position Meta as a leading AI technology developer, with ambitious goals including building a data center large enough to cover a substantial portion of Manhattan and acquiring over 1.3 million graphics processing units (GPUs) by year's end.The investment comes just days after President Donald Trump unveiled the Stargate initiative , a $500 billion AI infrastructure project backed by OpenAI, SoftBank, and Oracle. Zuckerberg's announcement is widely seen as a strategic response to maintain Meta's competitive edge in artificial intelligence.The company plans to significantly expand its AI workforce and develop an internal "AI engineer" capable of contributing to research and development coding tasks. Zuckerberg expects Meta's AI assistant to serve more than 1 billion people in 2025, up from approximately 600 million monthly active users last year.Meta's open-source approach with its Llama AI models, which allows free usage by consumers and businesses, distinguishes its strategy from rival tech companies. Article Summary: Meta Platforms, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp, plans to spend up to $65 billion in 2025. Mark Zuckerberg aims to position Meta as a leading AI technology developer. Zuckerberg expects Meta's AI assistant to serve more than 1 billion people in 2025, up from approximately 600 million monthly active users last year.
